channel.title: Iran on DDoSecrets Wiki
channel.description: Recent content in Iran on DDoSecrets Wiki

item.title: Ariantel
item.description: From Distributed Denial of Secrets RELEASE ArianTel 320,000 emails from ArianTel, an Iranian telecom company documenting Iranian surveillance systems and the SIAM system. DATASET DETAILS COUNTRIES Iran TYPE Hack SOURCE FILE SIZE 44 GB DOWNLOADS (How to Download) MAGNET [[[Link]]] TORRENT Link DIRECT DOWNLOAD Link MORE REFERENCES The Intercept EDITOR NOTES 320,000 emails from ArianTel, an Iranian telecom company documenting Iranian surveillance systems and the SIAM system. Research How Iran can track and control protestor’s phones (The Intercept)

item.title: Documents From Us Espionage Den
item.description: From Distributed Denial of Secrets RELEASE Documents from US Espionage Den CIA documents seized by Iranian students during the 1979 Iranian revolution, when the embassy was overrun. DATASET DETAILS COUNTRY Iran/United States TYPE SOURCE Iran FILE SIZE 375.75 MB DOWNLOADS MAGNET Link TORRENT Link DIRECT DOWNLOAD Link MORE REFERENCES Washington Post New York Times EDITOR NOTES In November 1979, Iranian students seized an entire archive of CIA and State Department documents, which represented one of the most extensive losses of secret data in the history of any modern intelligence service.

item.title: Nuclear Power Production And Development Company Of Iran
item.description: From Distributed Denial of Secrets RELEASE Nuclear Power Production and Development Company of Iran Over 100,000 emails from the Nuclear Power Production and Development Company of Iran, which runs Iranian research and development in the nuclear fuel cycle, including uranium exploration, mining and conversion. DATASET DETAILS COUNTRIES Iran TYPE Hack SOURCE Black Reward FILE SIZE 75 GB DOWNLOADS (How to Download) MAGNET [[Link]] TORRENT Link DIRECT DOWNLOAD Link MORE REFERENCES

item.title: Spyhide
item.description: From Distributed Denial of Secrets RELEASE SpyHide Source code and user data for the Android spyware software SpyHide. DATASET DETAILS COUNTRIES Germany, Iran TYPE Hack SOURCE maia arson crimew FILE SIZE 100 GB DOWNLOADS (How to Request Access) REFERENCES maia arson crimew EDITOR NOTES Source code and user data for the Android spyware software SpyHide dating from 2016 through mid-July 2023. Although SpyHide’s software was made in Iran and the servers were hosted in Germany, TechCrunch’s analysis identified at least 750,000 users and about 60,000 compromised devices in a surveillance network that spans every continent.
